chargeHist.descr: 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13

result.execSummary:
The defendant Kirk Jordan Simmons was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).
  • Child Enticement-Sexual Contact, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.07(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay mandatory costs, assessments and surcharges or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection.

Pay mandatory costs, assessments and surcharges.  DOC to collect monetary amounts at the rate of 25% of prison funds.  Balance to be paid as condition  of Extended Supervision,  by the end of the sentence or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with count one.  Credit for 54 days.

superMiscConds.notes:
No violations of criminal law rising to the leve of probabe cause.
No contact with C.P. dob 6/3/04.
No alcohol or illegally controlled substances.  Random screening.  Absolute sobriety.
Seek and maintain employment, sex offender treatment or counseling.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis and pay mandatory DNA surcharge.
Court advised defendant  he cannot possess firearms or body armor, he must provide a  DNA sample.  If this conviction is reversed, set aside or vacated you may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if you meet conditions under the statute.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additonal charge of bail jumping.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kirk Jordan Simmons

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Count two.
Count one.

Defendant Kirk Jordan Simmons in court with attorney Lori A. Kuehn.  Defendant Kirk Jordan Simmons in custody.  Jennifer Lynn Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Sentencing proceeds.  State has complied with victim notification.  Statements by counsel and defendant.  

COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms or firearms, he must provide a DNA sample, if this conviction is reversed, set aside or vacated you may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if you meet conditions under the statute, pay the mandatory DNA surcharge, cannot vote until his civil rights are restored, must comply wiht the sex offender registry and cannot work or volunteer with children under 16 years of age.

Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of GUILTY to amended Count 1 and Count 2 as charged and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum  received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty of Counts 1 & 2 as charged in the Amended Information and enters a judgment of conviction.

Parties advised the Court will listen to statements by counsel, victim, a friend or relative of the defendant and defendant.  Any other statements must be in writing and provided to the Court 72 hours in advance of sentencing.  Restitution will be addressed at that time.

Court orders defendant remanded into the custody of the sheriff pending sentencing.

Defendant Kirk Jordan Simmons in court with attorney Lori A. Kuehn.  Defendant Kirk Jordan Simmons in custody.  Jennifer Lynn Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Amended Information received and filed.  Defense acknowledges receipt of a copy of the Amended Information and waives reading.  Court AMENDS Count 1 to Fourth Degree Sexual Assault 940.225(3m) a class A misdemeanor;  Count 2 remains the same. 
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 11, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Kirk Jordan Simmons in court with attorney Lori A. Kuehn.  Defendant Kirk Jordan Simmons in custody.  Jennifer Lynn Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Parties ask for an adjournment for possible resolution.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 28, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection received and filed./ds
State's Motion in Limine received and filed./ds
State's Witness List received and filed./ds
State's Requested Jury Instructions and Instructions received and filed./ds
Defendant's Motion in Limine.
Defendant's Witness List.
Defendant's Proposed Jury Instructions.

Attorney Douglas Batt for Lori A. Kuehn in court, defendant Kirk Jordan Simmons not in court, in custody.  Jennifer Lynn Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defense has not received all the discovery.  SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND   Court finds all motions are waived and will not accept any plea negotiations.  Pretrial scheduling order received and filed.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 27, 2015 at 10:00 am.  Jury trial scheduled for June 3, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Signed and Filed, STIPULATION AND ORDER REGARDING USE OF VIDEOTAPED STATEMENTS.

Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Mark Peterson-MPD Detective.  Exhibit #1 is marked, offered and received into evidence.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 44.  Exhibit is ordered withdrawn.

Defendant Kirk Jordan Simmons in court with attorney Lori A. Kuehn.  Defendant Kirk Jordan Simmons in custody.  Jennifer Lynn Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Rothstein.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Konkol, Br. 44.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
Court ordered defendant to be maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: CP( dob: 6-23-2004) or her guardian, Cora QB.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Kirk Jordan Simmons in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Defendant Kirk Jordan Simmons in custody.  
Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rothstein, Branch 25.  
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.

Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wis. Stats. Section 165.77(4).

Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
